tp:treatment-sec.p: Five- to multi-armed asteroids possessing broad, short concavo-convex adambulacrals which possess a single row of large, transverse spine pits; adambulacrals articulate by means of transversely arranged specialised surfaces; abactinal ossicles stellate, large, with a central boss with which a long, glassy spine articulates.

Although
Plesiastropecten
is 5-rayed, the adambulacrals, abactinal ossicles and marginals are closely similar to those of
Plumaster
(see Gale 2011b ) and the genus is accommodated here.
